title: New U of Illinois financial task force thinking long term
text:
Financial task force at the U of Illinois aims to plan long term to deal with state cuts 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/6/15 12:08 pm EDT - Updated: 7/6/15 12:13 pm EDT 
URBANA, Illinois â€” One of the top administrators at the University of Illinois' flagship campus says a new task force looking at the school's budget aims to plot a long-term financial course. 
Ilesanmi Adesida (ill-ih-SHAHN'-mee uh-DISH'-eh-dah) is the provost at the Urbana-Champaign campus. He told The News-Gazette ( http://bit.ly/1LNYBoA ) that the school typically adjusts year to year as it watches state funding fall. 
Adjusting for inflation, state support for the university has dropped from more than $1 billion a year in fiscal 2002 to $662 million in the year that just ended. 
Adesida said the task force will discuss spending priorities for the next five to 10 years. 
He said the university may decide to consolidate or end some functions. But it also wants to produce more of its own revenue. 
Information from: The News-Gazette, http://www.news-gazette.com
